alert.note: Alert for Albany; Carbon (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued July 26 at 4:50PM MDT until July 26 at 5:30PM MDT by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: The National Weather Service in Cheyenne has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Northeastern Carbon County in south central Wyoming... Central Albany County in southeastern Wyoming... * Until 530 PM MDT. * At 449 PM MDT, outflow winds from severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 12 miles east of Seminoe Campground to near Elk Mountain to near Lincoln Park Campground, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Wyoming DOT road sensors reported wind gusts 55-60 mph. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Hanna, Medicine Bow, Rock River, Elk Mountain, Battle Mountain, Shirley Basin, Brooklyn Lake, Brooklyn Lake Campground, Sugar Loaf Campground, Libby Creek Campground, Bow River Campground, Deep Creek Campground, Nash Fork Campground, Lincoln Park Campground, Wheatland Reservoir 3, Little Medicine School, North Fork Campground, Arlington and Centennial. This includes Interstate 80 in Wyoming between mile markers 240 and 298. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
